item.description:
Woodcocks are fairly common in the forest, but have you seen one?  They arrive back around the first week in March and the males begin their dusk displays to attract females.  We will walk into the fields off Cutter Field Road at sundown to await the displaying timberdoodles. Sundown is 7:03ish and the birds should begin to fly 10-20 minutes after that. Meet at the Headquarters parking lot at 6:00 to carpool to Cutter's Field. Or come earlier to enjoy the BBQ! 

No dogs tonight please. But bring the kids they will love this!

BBQ Information 

Starting around 5:00PM, we will light a campfire in the amphitheater behind the Headquarters. We will provide veggie dogs and hot dogs but you have to cook them yourself using the ol'-stick method. We will also have coleslaw, cookies and drinks. If you plan to eat with us, please donate a few dollars to cover the cost of the food and please add an extra dollar or two to help us pay for this meetup.com site.

Does anyone know how to build a campfire?
item.how_to_find_us: Meet us at the Amphitheater behind the MSSF Headquarters. We will be next to the campfire roasting our dinner.
item.why: Glenn d'Entremont leads the most interesting bird walks and watching the woodcock mating ritual is amazing!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Woodcock Walk BBQ Dinner
